text: Robert Frank Nevin (March 18, 1938 – September 21, 2020) was a Canadian professional ice hockey right wing. He played 18 seasons in the National Hockey League (NHL) between 1957–58 and 1975–76. He was born in Timmins, Ontario. He was known for playing with Toronto Maple Leafs, New York Rangers, Minnesota North Stars, Los Angeles Kings and Edmonton Oilers. Nevin died on September 21, 2020 at the age of 82. ==References== Category:1938 births Category:2020 deaths Category:Canadian ice hockey right wingers Category:Ice hockey people from Ontario Category:Los Angeles Kings players Category:Memorial Cup winners Category:Minnesota North Stars players Category:New York Rangers players Category:People from Timmins Category:Stanley Cup champions
title: Bob Nevin
